input_text:
Job Title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst

Location: Dunwoody, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Health Care Provider, Other

Description:
Board Certified Behavioral Analyst (BCBA)Reliatus - Dunwoody / Atlanta, GA
Tagged: Autism, Board Certified Behavioral Health Analyst, BCBABoard Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
**THIS POSITION is centrally located and there is no travel required***
Salary: $75,000 - $100,000- Depending on ExperienceSchedule: Full-TimeTop Benefits!Medical, Dental, & Vision coverageLife Insurance and Supplemental Insurance programsPTO and Holidays401K
Job Description:
We are looking for passionate a BCBA to help us fulfill our mission to make a socially meaningful change in the lives of children and families. We want you to enjoy coming to work, so we dedicate and commit ourselves to making our teams feel valued, respected, and heard.We are a ABA-based provider group with home and center-based services in the New Orleans area and across the country. The treatment model is grounded in the implementation science of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA), Family-Centered Planning, Routines-Based Intervention, and family participation. BE's treatment philosophy is guided by the belief that services should be provided as early in a child's development as possible, be individualized for each child/family, and support the unique culture of each family. The BE treatment team is led by a BCBA who will engage the family in their child's treatment, coordinate care with other treatment professionals, work with community resources, supervise the behavior technician (BT) implementing the treatment plan, and develop a positive collaborative relationship with any other professionals working with the child and family.
This isn't just another place to work, it's a welcoming environment with a leadership team that champions every individual to achieve their potential.
Job Responsibilities:
You will be integral to ensuring the highest possible treatment outcomes for families affected by ASD. As a member of the team, the BCBA designs and manages individualized behavior programming including:Supervising direct 1:1 treatment service, developing individualized goals/objectivesConducting behavior assessmentsIndividualizing client treatment plansManaging RBTs/ BTsConducting monthly caregiver training
Job Qualifications:Master's degree in Applied Behavior Analysis or related field.BCBA Certification - Must hold a current certification by the BACB.BCBAs that require additional experience will be enrolled in our BCBA mentorship program.
With over 30-years of experience in recruitment, Reliatus Behavior Health is a leading provider of behavioral health staffing and recruitment services nationally. We have helped over 3000 people get hired into careers they love. Contact us at Reliatus Behavior Health and let us help you find a position and leave the tedious process of putting in dozens of applications. We will assess your skills and experience, give you a free resume review, help you with interview preparation and so much more for ZERO cost to you

Experience Level (if available): None
